Description: Ostracon that originates from the upper part of a pottery jar, made of a Nile B2 fabric, red slip on the surface. The sherd was cut into a rectangular shape, broken off at the right side. There are five lines of hieratic text written in black ink with the beginning of the teaching of Amenemhat on it, a lot of the text to the right is lost now. 1) [...] sA-R' ('Imn-m-HA.t)| 2) [...] Dd=f x' m-nTr sDm n- 3) [...] .kw m-HAw Hr- 4) (I5 as Determinative) 5) [...tmmt] khprw 1) [Beginning of the Teaching / made by the Majesty of the Dual King, Sehotepibre], / the Son of Ra Amenemhat, 2) [the justified, / when he spoke in a revelation / to his son, the Lord of All]. / He said, 'Rise as a god! / Listen to 3) [what I tell you, / that you may be king of the land, and rule the Banks, / increas]ing the 4) 5) [good. / Concentrate against subjects who prove non]-existent.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.6 outside E14.13, lower level
Bibliographic references: Parkinson and Spencer 2009 / The Teaching of Amenemhat at Amara West (p. 25-27)
